thread.title: The 10-Point.

author: Gerard Baker
title: The 10-Point.
text:
Good morning,
The State of Things
President Trump’s State of the Union address tonight will likely outline a broad agenda for the coming year, but he is also expected to wade into a more immediate political showdown: an immigration deal. With lawmakers no closer to reaching an agreement, the president’s address offers the White House an opportunity to build momentum toward a resolution—or to set it back. The Journal’s Gerald F. Seib has a tip for lawmakers on how to work with the president: He likes controversy, but he isn’t... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
